metaface.interaction
Class WordGraph

java.lang.Object
  metaface.interaction.WordGraph
public class WordGraph
extends Object

WordGraph is responsible for building word graphs from text stimulus and matching these graphs against text stimulus.

For example, consider the following questions:

  • what is vhml?
  • what is the virtual human markup language?
  • tell me about vhml?
  • describe vhml for me?
  • tell me about the virtual human markup language?

    • These questions should all result in the same answer, and therefore they can be combined into one word graph. The word graph nodes and arcs can also be weighed according to how often they occur in the text stimulus. Unimportant words such as a, an, and, the, of, is, are, was, etc. are give low weights.

    The word graph can now be compared to a user's text stimulus to examine how well it matches. A numerical score can be given due to the weights present in the word graph.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Simon Beard
